12 o'clock was all the old man had said, was it a suggestion or a warning?

# BITSY VERSION 3.0

! ROOM_FORMAT 1

POS 2 11,2

DLG a
this is ours

DLG b
don't

DLG c
...

DLG f
leave

DLG e
this is not for you

DLG d
go

DLG i
you shall regret this, turn back now.

DLG l
A mushroom.

DLG m
A small patch of daises. 

DLG n
Is this a tooth?

DLG o
Perhaps someone else did not escape.

DLG p
Was I dreaming?

DLG q
It is dusk, most of the flowers have gone to sleep.

END 0
You leave, for they have allowed you to live despite your trespass.

END 1
You allowed yourself to be cornered, the cats pounce upon you...this is your bloody end.

END 2
You have allowed yourself to be cornered, the cats surround you, but they do not pounce, and instead decide to keep you as their pet...at least until they tire of you, or grow hungry.

END 3
The sleeping cat considers you, and blinks slowly. Then in a flash you find yourself small, furry, and resting in the warming glow of a great red skull.
